page.title: 14Chilton Pigeon Club.
page.content: The members of Chilton Pigeon Club have their own small clubhouse near to the main road. When the pigeons are young a hard plastic ring is put on one of their legs. The ring tells where it comes from and who is the owner. eg. {NEHU} North East Homing Union {79DC} 1979 Durham Combine The pigeons race every Saturday from different race points from 50 to 100 miles away. They are trained once or twice each week from 30 to 50 miles. The birds are kept in lofts. Many lofts are on the allotments. Pigeon race times are measured in yards per minute. On the Friday the clocks are sruck (started up) and when the bird arrives at its loft a rubber ring is carefully removed from its leg placed in a thimble and timed in a printing clock.
